isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - CRANKSHAFT, MAIN BEARINGS, FLYWHEEL AND CRANKCASE - CRANKCASE (Reconditioning)

important.para: THROUGHLY CLEAN AND INSPECT THE CRANKCASE BEFORE AND AFTER RECONDITIONING.

step1.para: Clean all old gasket material from the machined surfaces of the crankcase, using a scraper. Clean the cylinder bore using soap, water and a nylon brush.
Remove the pipe plugs (located in the rear of the crankcase) which seal the oil passages and thoroughly clean all passages and bolt holes.

Remove the main oil gallery plug and use a nylon brush (3/8 in. dia.) to clean the main oil gallery, Figure 6.40
. Replace oil plug after coating with Aviation Permatext No. 3.

Remove the valve lifter oil gallery plugs (located in the front of the crankcase) by drilling a small hole in the plug and prying with a screwdriver. Clean the valve lifter oil galleries with a nylon brush (5/16 in. dia.). Replace the valve lifter gallery plugs flush to 9.060 in. (1.52 mm) below the crankcase surface, then stake.

note.para: Use Aviation Permatext No. 3 prior. to installing the main and valve lifter oil gallery plugs.

important.para: THREADS IN CRANKCASE BOLT HOLES MUST BE CLEAN AND BLOWN DRY WITH FILTERED COMPRESSED AIR. DIRT OR OIL IN HOLES MAY CAUSE BINDING AND/OR FALSE TORQUE READING DURING REASSEMBLY.
